functions.name: isObservable
functions.description: Test whether the given value is Francis observable or not

functions.name: constant
functions.description: Creates a constant Property with the given value.

functions.name: once
functions.description:
Creates a single-event EventStream with the given value. Stream
ends immediately after the value has been emitted.

functions.name: fromArray
functions.description:
Creates an EventStream that produces events from the given array. Once the
stream is activated, all events are emitted at the same tick. You can also send
errors by using `F.Error` event in the given array.

events.name: events
events.description: Events to be emitted to the subscribers

functions.name: fromBinder
functions.description:
When the last subscriber unsubscribes from this stream, subscriber function
gets disposed and the (optional) disposer function gets called.

subscribe.name: subscribe
subscribe.description: Subscriber function that is called at the stream activation

functions.name: fromCallback
functions.description:
Creates an EventStream from a function that accepts a callback. The function
is supposed to call its callback just once.

f.name: f
f.description: Function that gets called at the stream activation

functions.name: fromNodeCallback
functions.description:
Behaves the same way as `fromCallback`, except that it expects the callback
to be called in the Node.js convention: `callback(error, data)`, where error is
`null` if everything is fine.

f.name: f
f.description: Function that gets called at the stream activation

functions.name: fromPromise
functions.description:
Returns a single-value EventStream from the given promise. If promise is rejected,
an error event will be emitted instead of value.

abort.name: abort
abort.description:
Optional flag whether or not to call `promise.abort` if all subscribers
have been removed from the created stream.

functions.name: never
functions.description: Creates an EventStream that immediately ends

functions.name: repeat
functions.description:
Calls generator function which is expected to return an observable. When the spawned
observable ends, the generator is called again to spawn a new observable. If generator
returns a falsy value, the stream ends.

generator.name: generator
generator.description: Generator function that's supposed to return an observable or `null` to end the stream

functions.example: const events = F.repeat(i => i < 10 && F.fromArray([...Array(i).keys()].map(_ => i)))

functions.name: asEventStream
functions.description:
Restores the given observables type information. Fails if the
observable's runtime type is not EventSTream.

observable.name: observable
observable.description: Observable whose type information will be restored

functions.name: asProperty
functions.description:
Restores the given observables type information. Fails if the
observable's runtime type is not Property.

observable.name: observable
observable.description: Observable whose type information will be restored

functions.name: firstToPromise
functions.description:
Returns a Promise which will be resolved with the first event (or error) coming from
an Observable. Uses global ES6 promise implementation to construct the promise.

obs.name: obs
obs.description: Observable whose first event/error will be resolved to the promise

functions.name: toPromise
functions.description:
Returns a Promise which will be resolved with the last event (or first error) coming from
an Observable. Uses global ES6 promise implementation to construct the promise.

obs.name: obs
obs.description: Observable whose last event/error will be resolved to the promise

functions.name: sequentially
functions.description:
Creates an EventStream containing the given values emitted
with the given interval.

functions.name: fromPoll
functions.description:
Polls given function with given interval. Function should return plain values
or `F.Event` objects. Polling occurs only when there are subscribers to the stream.
Polling ends permanently when `f` returns `F.End`.

f.name: f
f.description: Function that will be called on each tick

functions.name: interval
functions.description: Repeats the single element indefinitely with the given interval

functions.name: later
functions.description:
Creates a single-element stream that emits the given
value after given delay.

functions.name: fromEvent
functions.description:
Creates an EventStream from events on `EventTarget` or `EventEmitter` object,
or an object that supports event listeners using `on`/`off` methods.
signatures: (target: EventTarget, event: string, args: any[]) => EventStream<ValueType>

target.name: target
target.description: EventTarget object whose events will be listened

args.name: args
args.description: Extra args passed to the `addListener` / `on` function

functions.name: repeatedly
functions.description: Repeats given elements indefinitely with the given interval.

functions.name: awaiting
functions.description:
Creates a Property that indicates whether observable is awaiting the other observable,
i.e. has produced a value after the latest value from the other. This is handy for
keeping track whether we are currently awaiting an AJAX response

toWait.name: toWait
toWait.description: Observable whose value is waited after each event of `obs`

functions.name: firstToCustomPromise
functions.description:
Works same as `firstToPromise` but offers way to use custom promise
implementation instead.

ctor.name: ctor
ctor.description: Constructor to the custom promise implementation

obs.name: obs
obs.description: Observable whose first event/error will be resolved to the promise

functions.example:
import * as Promise from "bluebird"
const bluebirdPromise = F.firstToCustomPromise(Promise, F.later(100, "tsers!"))

functions.name: toCustomPromise
functions.description: Works same as `toPromise` but offers way to use custom promise implementation instead.

ctor.name: ctor
ctor.description: Constructor to the custom promise implementation

obs.name: obs
obs.description: Observable whose last event/error will be resolved to the promise

functions.example:
import * as Promise from "bluebird"
const bluebirdPromise = F.toCustomPromise(Promise, F.later(100, "tsers!"))
